title: One Man Walking
name: One Man Walking
description: This is Craig Stanton's 3500 kilometer walking journey across Japan. The videos are geo-tagged via Seero.com

properties.name: A shrine in the woods
properties.description: Looking for a quite campsite in the woods I stumble upon an interesting shrine. I think it is for fertilityWatch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Asahi-dake
properties.description: Asahi-dake is the highest point on Hokkaido at 2,290m. It's part of Daisetsu-zan National Park where I have spent 3 days hiking.Watch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Cape Sata
properties.description: DAy one of a walk from Cape Sata, the southern tip of Japan to Cape Soya, the northernmost pointWatch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Cape Soya, northern tip of Japan
properties.description: After 95 days and 6 hours, the end of my walk from Cape Sata, the southern end of JapanWatch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Cape Soya, northern tip of Japan
properties.description: After 95 days and 6 hours, the end of my walk from Cape Sata, the southern end of JapanWatch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Day 107: California/Oregon
properties.description: It took over 3 months to complete California and I was glad to reach Oregon.Watch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Day 118: All down hill?
properties.description: The highest point on the PCT in Oregon and WashingtonWatch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Day 127: Snow cone
properties.description: Made from actual snow, and Emergen-CWatch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Day 12: Approaching Taqhuitz
properties.description: A windy night on the hills above IdyllwildWatch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Day 131: Under Tunnel Falls
properties.description: Eagle Creek isn't strictly on the PCT, but it's much cooler than the official trail, you walk under/behind a water fall!Watch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Day 136: The North Cascades
properties.description: Washington's North Cascade range is a spectacular part of the PCT. My second favourite part of the trail after the high sierras. Sadly a hiker, with the same name as me, died near here in an avalanche a month after I passed through.Watch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Day 137: Waptus River
properties.description: Another pleasant river in the North Cascade Range of WashingtonWatch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Day 141: Entering the forbidden zone
properties.description: In 2003 a major storm washed away bridges and trails in the Glacier Peak Wilderness. A less-scenic detour was set up but when that was destroyed by fire and floods in early 2007 construction started on the original route. We were lucky enough to see new bridges where hikers weeks earlier had to ford riversWatch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Day 143: Cooking with Craig
properties.description: I try a little of the local flora with my evening mealWatch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Day 147: Let it snow
properties.description: With just 60miles to the border the snow has started to fallWatch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Day 149: I can see Canada
properties.description: Now it really is all down hillWatch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Day 149: The end of the PCT
properties.description: That's it, I've reached the northern terminus. 2655 miles from Mexico. What a reliefWatch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Day 18: Pine Forest
properties.description: The heavy scent of pine forest makes for a pleasant afternoon break while looking for Scot Williamson's hidden spring.Watch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Day 19: Frisbee
properties.description: It's not all about walking. Sometimes it pays to relax with friends. It keeps you from going crazy, and getting blistersWatch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Day 19: Predators "in action"
properties.description: A sad sight indeed. Bears and tigers in miserable little cages kept away from the forest that surrounds themWatch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Day 28: Mt Baden-Powel
properties.description: Mt Baden-Powel is named after the founder of the Boy Scouts movement. Please excuse my maths, imperial measurements are not the most logical.Watch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Day 34: Slack packing in CA
properties.description: I found someone to carry my bag to the next house, so I had an easy 24 miles to do this day.Watch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Day 56: Summiting Mt Whitney
properties.description: Not strictly on the PCT but close enough that it's worth the climb. It's the highest point in the lower 48 states.Watch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Day 60: Swimming at 10,000ft!
properties.description: Thousand Island Lake is a very apt name for this ice cold water. The mosquitos were biting but it was soooo refreshingWatch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Day 67: Glisading
properties.description: Glisading is the art of sliding down snow rather than waste time walking down itWatch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Day 68: Muir Pass
properties.description: Named after John Muir, as many things are in this region he fought so hard to preserve, Muir Pass sits at 12,000ft in a pristine rock and snow world Watch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Day 7: Eagle Rock
properties.description: A natural rock formation just 20m for the PCT looks incredible like a......Watch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Day 80: Desolation Wilderness
properties.description: Dick's Pass in Desolation Wilderness, isn't all that desolate after allWatch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Day 86: North of Donner Pass
properties.description: After almost being wiped out by shin-splints I'm back on the trail and being more carefulWatch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Day 88: Rain at last!
properties.description: Camping in southern California is great because of the lack of rain, but every now and again you need a few drops to take the edge offWatch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Day 92: Halfway
properties.description: Halfway along the PCT. How would you feel to still have half left?Watch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Day 98: Camping on the rocks
properties.description: A good view of Mt Shasta and a bed of rocks. I'm a happy camperWatch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Day 99: My Home away from home
properties.description: See my camping set upWatch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Electric Baths
properties.description: Do electricity and water really need to mix?Watch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Everyone should live like this, once
properties.description: Tonight I sleep under the stars, and a lighthouse, on the coast north of Niigata.Watch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Haguro-san Five Story Pagoda
properties.description: This pagoda has been standing for 600 years. Surrounded by even older trees it is still used for ancient festivalsWatch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Ishizuchi-san
properties.description: The highest point in western Japan, so naturally ther is a temple up thereWatch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Isukushima
properties.description: The giant 'floating' torri at the Isukushima shine on Miyajima is one of Japan's "Three famous views"Watch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Jurokurakan-Iwa
properties.description: Carved my monks a long, long time ago, these '16 rocks' are like a religious Mt. Rushmore on a much smaller scale. And by the sea.Watch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Kappore folk dancing
properties.description: In the Sapporo train station I watched a "special dance to show love toward each other"Watch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Lavendar of Furano
properties.description: Farm Tomita is one of the most popular lavendar viewing spots in the Furano area of central HokkaidoWatch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Leaving work
properties.description: Leaving work for the last time I head to the wild woods of JapanWatch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Matsushima Bay
properties.description: Hundreds of small islands fill the bay to make it one of Japan's Three Famous ViewsWatch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Nijo Castle
properties.description: Nijo Castle in Kyoto. A nice spot for cherry blossom viewing.Watch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Osorezan
properties.description: A volcanic land of steaming rock piles and sulphur lakes. A place where the spirits of dead children leave this world. Watch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Pilgrim Shelter
properties.description: The 88 temple tour of Shikoku can be hard on people, so some nice locals maintain shelters like this for the pilgrimsWatch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Princess Tatsuko
properties.description: On the edge of Japan's deepest lake, I (try to) have lunch with a princessWatch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Shibuya Intersection
properties.description: Only the busiest pedestrian intersection in the world will do for me.Watch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Starting the PCT
properties.description: The Pacific Crest Trail stretches across 2,600 miles of desert, meadows and mountains from Mexico to CanadaWatch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Summer Solstice
properties.description: On the PCT the summer solstice, the longest day of the year, is known as 'Hike Naked Day'. Fine if you're alone in the mountains but I don't think it'll catch on here. Watch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: T-1000
properties.description: At last I am within 1000km of Cape Soya (in a straight line, which the road is not)Watch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Tamagawa Hotsprings
properties.description: Known for it's health-giving properties Tamagawa Onsen has an area where people come just to breathe and absorb the sulphuric steam Watch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: The coast north of Niigata
properties.description: The coast north of Niigata is remarkably like that of t Big Sur heading south from San Francisco to LA. Sandy beaches, jagged rocks and unlikely treesWatch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: The longest suspension bridge in the world
properties.description: The longest suspension bridge in the world crosses from Ajajishima to Honshu, and you're not allowed to walk on it :(Watch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: There may be a problem
properties.description: Roadworkers try to convince me that the only way to go north is in their truck, but I have other ideasWatch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Ueno Park Cherry Blossoms
properties.description: Hanami, cherry blossom viewing, happens across Japan in spring time as ts turn pink out to picnicWatch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: Walk Walk Walk
properties.description: It's a long flat road, again, and I'm beginning to get a bit downWatch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>

properties.name: near Kagoshima
properties.description: Day five of Craig's walk across JapanWatch this video!by: Craighomepage: One Man Walking]]>
